meanings.definition: To shout 'huzzah' in celebration or approval.
meanings.sent1: The crowd huzzahed loudly when the team won the game.
meanings.sent2: She huzzahed with joy when she received the good news.
meanings.sent3: The children huzzahed happily at the surprise party.
meanings.sent4: The entire town huzzahed in unison, echoing through the streets.
meanings.sent5: The fans huzzahed in excitement, their voices filling the stadium.

meanings.sent1: After the successful performance, the audience huzzahed in unison.
meanings.sent2: Huzzahed! The victory was finally achieved.
meanings.sent3: Huzzahed with relief, knowing the hard work had paid off.
meanings.sent4: The old man huzzahed nostalgically, remembering his youth.
meanings.sent5: The crowd huzzahed happily, celebrating the end of the war.

meanings.definition: To express joy or approval by shouting 'huzzah'.
meanings.sent1: The supporters huzzahed in excitement as their team scored a goal.
meanings.sent2: He huzzahed with pride as his artwork was displayed in the gallery.
meanings.sent3: The students huzzahed cheerfully at the end of the school play.
meanings.sent4: The audience huzzahed enthusiastically, showing their appreciation for the performance.
meanings.sent5: She huzzahed joyfully, feeling grateful for the support of her friends.
